intro: Gaya lyallii, commonly known as the Lyall's gaya, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
